title: Instant exchange. Spending budget. Really missing the old view tho
text: There isn’t another app like this.. there isn’t a bank like this.. I travel internationally and I can exchange currencies instantly - send and receive all currencies - I didn’t believe it when I heard about Revolut - I love that I can set budgets and set funds aside set goals etc.. I really do miss the statistics view of my spending/balance, mainly the  all time/monthly/weekly/daily view.. what happened to that? Regardless, I’m really happy I signed up and I continue to refer my friends and family!!

title: impossible find support chat
text: If you don’t have access to your Revolut App. It the same like you lost your account for ever . I’m trying 5 days recover my email. Biggest problem, in Revolut  you can contact with live support just when you will login to your Account in App. Also if you calling on support phone number you will be never speak with human.. always robot sending you to App for live chat. Also in App you never find email recover… but email have more risk be hacked than phone number. So if you lost your email address = you lost your account with your money. No one will not help you . This is Biggest biggest problem. For this moment i don’t know where  find connect with Revolut support. And i can’t recover my email. And can’t use my account with my money.

title: New interface makes some features hard to find
text: I was happier with the app before this batch of updates to the interface. I don’t understand why they are hiding a key feature of the app - that is, to check currency exchange rates and set up alerts or actions. I check this frequently and since the update waste minutes clicking on buttons trying to find it. And now the helpdesk is harder to find as well. It used to be in such a handy place - really easy to find and reassuring. I’m definitely not a fan of the new interface layout. It doesn’t work for me, a Metal subscriber. I hope you fix it, Revolut, as I was a pretty big fan before my key functions were hidden away.

title: Disappointed Loyal Customer
text: I've been a satisfied Revolut user in Europe for nearly 4 years. However, my experience transitioning to the US has been a continuous loop of disappointment. Despite multiple attempts to verify my identity following their own staff's advice, I've been given the runaround, with multiple representatives providing inconsistent guidance. It's deeply frustrating and time-consuming to be asked repeatedly to close and reopen accounts, and even more annoying to be told to avoid providing necessary residency information to be able to have an account. Revolut, I expected more given my longstanding loyalty. It’s essential to respect your customers' time and offer consistent, transparent solutions. This has unfortunately tainted my once positive view of your service.

title: Transfer Diverted back to sender for no reason
text: I paid $35 from my other bank account to wire it into my revolut account. i needed to pay my landlord overseas and this was the cheapest option. all day the wire never posted despite the sending bank saying they received it. all of my info was tripple checked correct. this already made me very nervous but every agent i spoke to said that wires into their accounts can take up to 2 business days. i’ve always thought it was same day. at 7pm (nearly 10 hours after i first sent the wire) revolut says they’d reversed the wire back and it will take 5 business days to go back into my account. FOR NO REASON but the “automatic system” had a glitch and sent it back. that’s absolutely pathetic. If they wanted to help me they could have!

title: Decent platform, slow to establish account
text: I like the app, but Revolut is very slow when initially opening an account and customer support is not helpful. I’ve linked and verified my debit card and checking account. It’s been 4 days and I still cannot add money to my account. I’ve spoken to two different live agents for help and each time their solution was “please wait”. Not a huge deal in the grand scheme of things, but I opened my account to do a large currency exchange. Their feet dragging has cost me more than $500 as the exchange rate has worsened in that timeframe. I initially chose Revolut for their slightly better rate than their competitors, but in hindsight I should have gone with a dedicated currency exchange platform.

title: Elena Atanasova
text:
Greetings to everyone that are interested in opening an account in Revolut. I want to share with you about my awful experience.
I have opened an account, subsequently there was an issue with the verification, so I contacted the customer service of Revolut. 
The Customer service was hacked somehow, and the people who represented themselves as Revolut employees stole 3000 pounds from my account. When I realized, it was too late. The bank said that my money was transferred into Revolut account. I’ve contacted the police they’ve opened an investigation, after that I’ve collected all of the information , including phone calls, messages all of the information needed about this whole fraud, all they needed to do is block the account and refund my lost money, which they didn’t.
I am very disappointed I thought Revolut is reliable online bank for international use but apparently is not the company that claims to be!
Nobody answers my messages in the live chat or elsewhere. 
All I want to say is if you want your money safe think twice before opening an account in Revolut, they are not an reliable online bank, they couldn’t keep my money safe, next time it could be you.

title: Zero functions available in the US
text: If I could, I would give zero stars. I signed up four months ago with Revolut US and I am unable to receive/requests payments from anyone. The entire point of opening a Revolut account was to be able to transact internationally and receive payments from my work clients. I am extremely disappointed and annoyed! Customer service is terrible as well - there is no phone assistance and whenever I try to chat, I get automated responses even though it says I am talking to a person.

title: Can’t add money no one to speak to
text:
Revolut is bizarre and scary.  I’ve tried over 30 times to add money from a debit card and linked bank account and it won’t complete transfers.  I linked to one specific bank account and Revolut accessed another account at that bank without authorization forcing me to close down and transfer money out of the bank to safeguard my savings.  Again, absolutely no way to speak to a customer service rep at Revolut. How does Revolut have government approval?  I have also tried reaching out to Metropolitan Commercial Bank without luck because it has very limited hours and it hides phone numbers on its website.

Absolutely worthless customer service when one can get through via chat.  Frank who I spoke to could not have been less knowledgeable or less helpful.

title: Reconsider going w/ Revolut, they will lock your account and steal your funds!!
text: The only way to contact a Revolut representative, is through the chat, in the app, there's NO phone number associated w/ them, that let's you speak to a live person! & the chat representatives, they respond whenever they want, which isn't often. The account is locked, so, I can't go into the settings, to adjust the notifications, to make sure that I am notified, whenever a chat does come through, therefore, I ALWAYS miss their responses! Not to mention, the responses are talking in circles, & not assisting, with the unlocking, of the account. My funds have been tied up, OVER A WEEK, though I sent all of the necessary documents, that they asked for. They will just take your money, & there won't be anything you can do, about it!!!

title: Customer Service?  Flaccid and impotent!
text:
I only regret that I am unable to give negative stars.  Account was locked, could not add, remove, linked cards or bank accounts.  No explanation as to why, only we are diligently working on restoring your account, we have no further information, we are sorry for your inconvenience, blaa, blaa, blaa.  Now, this is is all through their chat.  You can never actually speak with anyone.  Even a formal complaint sent via email was answered with “How is this chat we’ll handled?”  
That. Speaks. Volumes.  
Avoid!

title: Just locked my out of my account for no reason whatsoever
text: ‘Something went wrong’ and now I have no access to my money. First it didn’t allow me access to my account because I needed to answer some questions as to why I’m using revolut it wouldn’t accept my answers kept telling me “we’re sorry something has gone wrong. Please try again later” and I had no access to my money so I reinstalled the app. Huge mistake because now it refuses to allow me to log in and keeps saying ‘something went wrong’ even though I authenticated it with my email, phone number and selfie. Absolute joke. I am extremely disappointed. What am I suppose to do now when I can’t even get to their infamous chat as I have no access to my account??

title: Dropped my Bank for this
text:
Excellent customer support (if you’re pro, else you have to wait days, but hey, free means no priority support). Had no issues whatsoever except for 2 times they had problems with their payment processor. I could pay, but transactions were reverted and after a few days corrected. 

They have still growing pains, you should have a backup, I’m all in for 4 months and I love it. This is the future. 

Also support via chat is so convenient as you can answer later and don’t have to stay on the line to get help. You also can send screenshots. Very helpful. 

Beware that the pro version binds you to a 12 month contract. 

Your money is secure and guaranteed by 2 London banks and Apple Pay is coming later this year. 

Sorry US customers, as they are rate limiting subscribers. Don’t be paranoid it’s not a scam, they just can’t roll up infrastructure so fast. I imagine it will take another 6 months.

title: Better options than Revolut
text: I use Wise all the time and never have a problem. Revolut on the other hand is a mess. I don’t trust it one bit to get my transactions right. Can’t link my major account and there is no one to help me. Customer service is almost nonexistent. I have withdrawn all my funds and will soon close my account. With Revolut there is no there there. UPDATE: Wow. Just closed my crappy account and even that was a difficult task. It’s not worth it people. If you go with Revolut be prepared for zero customer service. You’re on your own so you better hope you have no problems. UPDATE: Just deleted the app from my phone. Felt good. Just glad I never could transfer funds to Revolut so I didn’t have issues getting my money back.

title: Horrible support and never send cards.
text: I applied a year ago, got approved and waited for my free cards forever. It never came. In the app the force you to pay to get a new card. What? I didn’t loose the card. After one year, I finally decided to give a try, paid for their card subscription $4.99, not big deal, but the card never arrived again. The address is correct, the other banks send me cards in days. Most disappointing there is no chance to contact support to resolve problem on their end. It’s ok things happen, but when you charge money you must deliver on your promise or godo business you capable to to do not this one. Revolut lost my trust without event starting using their service. I prefer service where they rvalue customers.

title: Stay away
text:
I wanted to test them out, first transaction went smoothly however the second one (same funding source and same end user receiving money) and my account is locked with no customer service to speak of unless you are a paying member. 

It seems to be a way for them to lure you into membership to get service and lock your funds. 4 hours and no response so far. Will update my review tomorrow so non-paying customers are aware of response times but more importantly to prevent this from happening to other users. Financial transactions should have a clear SLA and response times and generic response I’ve received Is it is 24 just for a response-not a resolution or to a refund. This is a very bad business practice for a fintech company

title: No help at all
text: I downloaded this app because I am visiting Amsterdam where they mainly take a card system offered by Revolut called Maestro. I accidentally ordered the wrong card type. Trying to fix my mistake, my app is now stuck in a loop of trying and failing to verify my identity. I’ve emailed them about a dozen times now and their responses take days and now weeks to respond. I was told to use the in app support system but tried to explain that my app was unusable even after reinstalling. It’s been 3 weeks of struggling to get anyone to help and it’s been over a week since I last heard from them stressing my urgency of the matter. Now I’ve wasted money stuck in my unusable account and I have yet to hear back about what to do now.

title: No invitation
text: I signed up for an account on the 28th of august and received an email with "we’ll contact you when your invitation is ready". It’s September 6th now. It’s been 10 days. I have sent emails and Facebook pms 3 days ago but haven’t gotten a reply. The only place to get help according to the website is through the in-app support chat. Funny enough you can’t access that unless you have access to an account. I am leaving to another country and was looking forward to using the services Revolut offers… but now by the time I ever get an invitation + the extra time to get a debit card sent, I might as well forget it.  Pretty disappointed. Mainly when friends who signed up at the same time got their invitation days after.

title: Concerning detail correspondence with previous review
text: Wow that’s crazy I’m having the same exact issue as the girl with unemployment problems but instead my situation is my income tax refund was sent to my credit karma and her story literally aligns with mine to a T they were giving me no explanation and kept saying a higher team was investigating after verifying my official documents quad-dripple times I had to call the irs major credit bureau to find out what was up then I involved the B.B.B and so credit karma closed my account and wrote me a check for the funds wth is wrong with these banks 😳

title: The intro thing…
text:
I haven’t really had any major issues. I’m not using it internationally or so the only thing that bugs me is one, small thing that bugs me for reasons I can’t quite figure out. 

EVERY time I start the thing, I get the “add $20 to start” thing despite doing that exact thing multiple times. First world problem? Yes, very much so. But it bugs me just enough to want to point it out. 

Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have the feeling there are some kids loitering on my lawn and I need to go yell at them. I didn’t think you developed that sense ‘til way after 34 but…

title: Trash Support
text:
Please check out their Twitter page of the amount of users who have had issues with this so-called bank closing their accounts. I can’t believe I even suggested for people to download this app lol. Run run run or else you are going to be hungry like me looking for your next meal because a horrible financial institution that outsource his customer service. I didn’t have any issues until recently when I inquired about missing funds. I came across the Twitter page and I saw that so many people had the same issue and was locked out of their accounts for six months to a year. Run run run!

This company is used to the bad reviews. They don’t care. Fill out the petition on the Internet to remove them from the app stores.

title: I use it as my mine card but
text: I use it as my main card when purchasing as I have accounts in usd eur and bg lev. The only draw back for me is that I cannot change currency for budget. I would like to change it as I wish, depending on the country I am in at that given moment. It’s fixed in BG Lev but that’s the currency I use the least. Same goes for when selecting “All Accounts” it is always in BG Lev (my home currency). I would like to change the value as a go; otherwise I waste time converting the value from one to another everyday to see my total net worth.

title: Incomplete service
text: Spoke to an who Agent seemed like he didn’t know what he was doing. The app needs a lot of work still I can’t check my transfer history, I can’t exchange my monies into the currency I need, crypto is still not accepted for buying or depositing (which is the main reason I signed up). Since I can’t check my transfer history I can’t cancel any transfers which leads to a ridiculous one day hold of your money. Then I get locked in to a 12 month commitment contract which is stupid in its self like I wanted the metal card which I was offered a few days before but when I upgraded my plan my only option was plastic the perks for paying $120 a year are underwhelming. I won’t be back until these issues are fixed.

title: So where’s the money?
text:
I regularly send money to a friend in Europe.  I transfer dollars to my Revolut account and exchange them for Euros and then send.  Everything is quite fast but the process of moving the money from my bank to Revolut is very slow.  For example, this month I requested a transfer on the 1st of the month. Today is the 7th and the money has not yet arrived.   Last month there was a similar delay.  

With other services, such as Wise, the entire process of moving the money from my account to my friend’s takes only two to three days.  

I find it hard to believe this is the best Revolut can do.

title: Difficult Interface
text:
Updated after Developer response (thank you)

It took me a while to get around in Revolut, what is obvious to them isn’t necessarily obvious to a user. Once you know your way around the app and service function as expected. 

Unclear interface and user experience in some important ways, unless you work for Revolut:

For example  I tried to find help about returning funds back to spending from a vault (savings), but they refer to a link that says “withdraw” under the Vault page. But what they don’t tell you is that to get there you must:
1. Click on the menu item Vaults
2. Even though you are already there, you must click on your vault again from a list which isn’t obvious unless you’ve created more than one Vault. 
3. Click on your desired vault, in my case just one. 

Result: after a bit of rabbit holing, you will find the Withdraw link. 

Just an example of “difficulty”. There are others but trying to keep this short.

title: A solid F for customer service
text: It seems clear that customer service in the US will not get any better than current sad state if we don't invest in local Engineering talent in the US, rather than shipping first front digital service jobs to poorly educated Indians with poor English language skills is a move backwards not forwards at all! How do I know!? Because if those people overseas were any good, they would be already here in the state site. Why?! Because I am a real mechanical engineer with dual masters degrees in engineering and MBA. That's why I am closing this otherwise wonderful app for poor service and even poorer business practices. Please support your local engineers and technical pesonel here to make it better for all of us living in one nation under God! Cheers!

title: A little confusing at first but a great app!
text:
I had a rough start but only because I didn’t read the help- which answered all my questions. This app is definitely a keeper! Thanks for the awesome app!
I still love the app since it is the only way I’ve found so far that i am able to move money between my own accounts- the only downside I’ve found is that it isn’t an immediate transfer, I don’t see the transferred amount in my account until the following day, but it does seem to make it without any issues.

title: Waste of Time
text: I was never motivated enough to write a review for an app - but, from how bad this one is, I feel extremely motivated. So, I’ve downloaded this app for 50 times so I can try to sign up. Every time I reach the ‘Accept’ phase of the terms and conditions, the button doesn’t register. So, I’m stuck trying to get past that. It’s odd how it can take you over a day to sign up for a card; I’m sure doing it physically at a bank would be more convenient and quicker than this! Which is funny because I thought the whole point of a virtual credit card is speed and convenience. If signing up is such a struggle, I can’t imagine the other struggles that will come with owning a card (whether physical or virtual), especially after reading other reviews.

title: Terrible customer service and bugged card
text: Was charged after closing the single use cards that they offer which I used for subscriptions thinking I would only be charged once. But somehow charges were still able to go through for cards you have no access too. Customer service promised the charges would be rejected. 2 days later the charges were completed and not rejected. Customer service then transferred me multiple times, said they are waiting to hear from a relevant team and just stops responding. Different agents giving different answers and after a whole day was unable to resolve my issue. Overall horrible service and customer reps. Would not recommend.

title: Don’t care about their customers.
text:
The app is fine. But God does Revolut not know how to operate as a trusted bank :(

Chargebacks are a HUGE pain and takes weeks or even months to resolve and unless the company that you are making a chargeback against literally says they are scamming you, they might not even help you at all.

Whereas if you make a chargeback with any customer caring bank, you usually get the refund immediately, the bank then does their investigation and ONLY if the business that you made a chargeback against can prove they provided you what they claimed. They will charge the money back from you.

I have had 2 chargeback requests in limbo forever now. #1 a flight that got cancelled, you’d think this would be really simple since it’s completely verifiable. But the chargeback has been pending over a month!!!

I tried contacting their support again (which is ONLY possible through chat) and it won’t even let me connect saying there’s higher than usual traffic. It doesn’t put me in a queue or anything, just kicks me back to the Home Screen.

Worst customer experience I’ve ever had with a bank...

title: Great in Theory, horrible in practice
text: It works great until one’s phone is stolen or changes phone numbers. Despite providing Revolut with an alternative authentification email, it will not let me access my account on my new number after my phone was stolen. You can log onto your account online, but no transfers or unlocking of cards can be done without having my original number. Whats worse, customer service is only available through the app, which you need your original number to access. I have been unable to access my funds for weeks. If you’re looking for a service that can help you when you run into issues, please seek another online institution. Ive heard great things about Monzo.

title: Terrible customer service for serious cases
text: Made a reoccurring €2500 transfer to revolut, and the last one didn’t show up in the Revolut account.  I contacted both banks, mine said they would investigate but from the looks of it everything is correct from their end, and revolut doesn’t even have someone to talk to.  It’s a chat, a rude one at that, demanding they are not to blame and we must consult our bank.  No attempt to look into anything or provide any information.  They just brush you off.  Also, it wasn’t uncommon for your balance to be incorrect in the app.  You had to restart the app.  With all these problems and no insurance in the case they loose all my money, I will not be using their service anymore.

title: Would have given a hundred stars if I could
text: I absolutely love the app and what you guys are doing. Got notified about suspicious activity - amazing job on the user flow by the way - I was so confused at the moment, but the app asked me if it was me, suggested freezing the card and reordering a new one (for free!!!) while I was still shocked by what happened. The whole thing took 2 mins. I am so impressed! Thank you for this amazing experience! (P.s. I tried Trasferwise too and I think they are still in business only bec their users don’t know about Revolut)

title: Getting better
text: This no doubt has some issues but it’s free to buy and sell crypto and stocks. Anywhere else it’s $2.99 every buy and sell at least, here it’s free. As far as a significant amount of money I’d find a bigger broker with customer service. The tools are very simplified and useful. I don’t have much but my overall portfolio gained 20% I’m the last year just by watching daily for some buy low sell high. With no fees you can take $5-10 without losing to fees so I like it.

title: Poor customer service!
text: I did a transfer and it was over their limit (I had no idea what the limit was) and I have now been waiting on hold for over an hour trying to speak with someone to track down my money! The customer service is incredibly poor and the app is only designed for small transfers for which they charge you an annual fee so you really don’t save any money at all! It’s basically just another way if ripping off the consumer disguised as a tech company! Will likely go the way of theranos!

title: I recommend Revolut to everyone I know!
text: I’ve been using Revolut since they launched in the US, and I’ve held off on making a review to see if I truly liked them. I came from Chase and haven’t looked back. The only thing keeping me from a 5 star review is the inability to mobile-deposit checks. I keep a credit union account with no fees open just so I can deposit checks then transfer the money to Revolut. It’s extremely inconvenient. Other than that, I love the security, rewards, and savings features. I even upgraded to the metal account for more benefits and couldn’t be happier.

title: Amazingly Designed, Great Service & Reliable App
text:
Revolut is amazing they have a very reliable service and well built app for mobile. Absolutely love the metal plan that gives you a metal card, very impressed with that would be pretty upset if they ever toon that away. But would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a honest bank experience without all the BS.

Only critique I have and it’s not a big deal just a suggestion, would be nice to have a web portal as well not just for the business accounts :)

title: Worst mistake ever
text: My worst mistake ever has been to install and use revolut for the past 6 months Nothing but trouble with service and constant harassment from revolut support staff asking for proof of why I am paying people They even forced me to provide screenshots of my chats with my cleaning lady and personal trainer to get my account unlocked last month for a “security check” Today they closed my account with no reason and I now must wait 2-3 weeks for my refund of money I had in my account This is a terrible terrible terrible business that is run by what i suspect are international criminals (sources can be found online) Do not mess with these idiots Stay clear Do not use revolut. You will regret it if you do.

title: Very bad customer experience
text: After being a customer for 3 years I got notified that I need to resubmit my ID documents. I did that and immediately got notified that my account will be deactivated for reasons that they can’t share with me. I had been contacting Support for 20 days trying to understand what’s wrong, if they need additional documentation etc. I was told that they are looking into this, it’s under review etc. I had enough of this and decided to reach out for one last time. They came back saying that they can no longer offer their services but can’t disclose the reason. If Revolut is planning to disrupt the Financial Services industry they should start fixing their processes and “customer support”.

title: Scammers, do not use!
text: They offered a promo that I tried to take advantage of and they totally lied about it, once I asked why I haven’t received the promo a week after I should of had it they were rude and literally asked if I had any patience. They have YET to give me my promotion offer and constantly tell me to wait until they can investigate. They have had me waiting for them to respond for 2 days now because they do not know why nor can they assure that this will be fixed. This has been a Week and a half process at this point. Great way to treat a new customer. I would never use this app, I believe they are scammers. Horrible service, horrible customer service, save yourself the the trouble.

title: Unable to open account
text: This app came highly recommended but unfortunately I have been in a bind to even open an account. I initially downloaded it but didn’t provide the verification documents required in time to start using the account. I understand that was problematic on my end. But there seems to be no way out of this situation. When I open the app, my phone number isn’t accepted in order to go in the app itself, and there is no button to press for help. When I go to their website help section, it says they will only talk with me through the app (which I can’t enter). Deleting and reinstalling the app doesn’t change anything. Very disappointing that there is a closed circle that leaves no options to use this.

title: Cannot sign in (update)
text:
Update: the network I was using was blocking some of the requests apparently. Disabling wifi and using the mobile network resolved my problem.

I have changed the rating to 4 stars, leaving one off because the lack of any errors made it very difficult to determine the cause of the problem.

Original review below:

Put in my phone number and PIN, it sends a verification email, tap the button, sends me to a browser which then sends me to the App Store. Endless circle. Deleting the app and reinstalling does nothing. There is no other option for verifying login so I’m completely stuck. I don’t love using a review for this but I also can’t find a way to get support. I tried tapping “chat with us” on the website but it doesn’t work. Definitely can’t recommend. I would hate to be depending on this service and be in this situation.

title: US citizens stay away!
text: They show a rocket ship promising they are coming soon the the Unites States. I signed up 6 months ago and they are impossible to get in contact with. Only way to communicate with them is with the app, but the major issue is the app doesn’t work yet for US citizens unless you invite other people to join and sign up for app. No email address no phone contact. This company took all the personal information a bank needs to take and then refuses to communicate. I understand US banking regulations are exhaustive and vary state to state, but they stated their goal Q1 of 2018 for their launch. I signed up at the start of the new year and it’s now June! Can’t even cancel account with them because of lack of communication on their end.

title: Completely TRASH!!!
text: Trash trash trash!!!! All this company did was steal and hold my money. Customer service is TRASH!!! Rude employees who, virtually can’t assist with anything other than telling you what you can see on the app. You’re sent automated messages even when “talking” to a live agent. Outgoing transfers and transactions are a no go with this company. EVERY metal account transaction and most outgoing transfers are declined or get held for days on end… with no avail or assistance to access. I have a spouse with Cancer, and this account was set up specifically to be the medical account… COLOSSAL mistake. My husband has missed appointments and purchases because of constant account locks and no actual verification process. Run in the other direction.

title: Nice new look to app. Would like to be able to flip to inverse rate on charts though
text:
New app version 7 has has changed the UI a lot, but it’s packed with new features- very nice!
One ask for the developers: it would be great if you can flip rates when you look at a Rates screen to see the inverse rate. And to be able to link to the auto actions you’ve set up for that currency, while looking at that currency. Right now you have to navigate to another part of the app to find your actions.

title: Theives.
text: After waiting a year to get the account I deposit my first “top up”. It clears my bank account the following day and 2 weeks later I have yet to receive my money. I’ve reached out to support 3 times to request my money back and was told there was an issue with their “batch processing”. Well I’m a seasoned engineer and I’ve not only built payment systems but I’ve legally “audited” a few banking systems leading to the withdrawal of large sums of money... so I know how things work. I know you’re international and you’re probably still using swift even though you offer crypto accounts in other countries.... or maybe that’s it. The recent fall in XRP or some other cryptocurrency and the misappropriation of funds has you in a bind.... hhhmmmmm.... ????

title: Awful costumer service. Doesn’t work for US people
text:
Joined Revolut as my partner from Europe told me to, however for People living in the US this is a disaster. Their system can’t verify SSN, when you report the issue they don’t give you a time frame, a tracking number or any way to follow the process. On top of that their costumer service gives very vague answers and don’t solve your issue at all. They also never send you the emails they said they would and you have to be chasing them around in the app chat. 
If you’re looking for an e wallet I suggest you stick to Venmo or something that works in the US and don’t waste your time with a company that is not serious about solving your issue.

title: Garbage
text:
Kafkaesque nightmare, this service looks like it was designed in the Soviet Union in 1926. Completely lacks elegant workflow. Over featured bloat ware that tries to be cool. The morons who designed this should be fired. There is a massive need for what the app tries to solve. These guys missed the boat.

Update:  It gets even worse.

One of the values of a credit or debit card company is dispute resolution.  The company is supposed to have your back if you get cheated by a vendor.  That was not my experience last summer with Sepaq, a Quebec government entity.  The dispute amount was minor, less than $10.   Revolut was utterly worthless.  I would not trust them with any major transaction.  My experience is they won’t be there when you need them.

title: Impossible to add funds
text:
I tried for a week to add funds, using two linked bank accounts and two debit cards. Attempts to transfer $400 were rejected from both bank accounts, despite Revolut having full visibility and knowledge of the balances. Apparently $400 - I.e, about a weeks grocery bill - was above my limit. I did finally then get a debit card verified - another ordeal - but transactions kept getting declined. I assume these were also above my limit. I spent 90 minutes with the online chat people - no phone support - but they couldn’t help, or tell me what my limit was. I finally admitted defeat this morning and closed the account.

It’s a great idea, but the implementation is deeply flawed.

title: Full of bugs, which is not what you want in a bank
text:
I attempted to sign up for Revolut, but every time I open the app it asks for my SSN, and it won’t let me transfer money. I spent hours talking with support and being promised that it had been fixed (but the fix might take 24 hours to go through, so get off the line and call back tomorrow).  Eventually I was told that this is a bug that stops some people with US addresses from activating their accounts.  It is apparently still unfixed.

A quick trip to the forums shows many more people encountering many more bugs in this service, leading to experiences much worse than mine — after all, I haven’t been able to give them any of my money yet.

Furthermore, Revolut’s security practices are questionable.  For example, if they want your feedback they will send you a link that requests your account credentials.

Overall, this app could be convenient for sending small amounts of cash — if it works at all for you — but don’t trust it with a significant amount of money.
